iiv.dialog

Class ShowPointDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • iiv.dialog.CNUDialog
                • iiv.dialog.ShowPointDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NumberFormattable, ShowPointDialogInterface, ShowPointDisplay, ShowPointTracker, iiVScriptable, ShowStatus, java.awt.event.ContainerListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class ShowPointDialog
extends CNUDialog
implements ShowPointDialogInterface, ShowPointTracker, ShowPointDisplay, java.awt.event.ContainerListener, NumberFormattable, iiVScriptable
    Dialog to display coordinate values and locations.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUDisplay, Serialized Form

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Overridden to pack this dialog before going visible the first time. This dialog became the wrong size if additions were made after packing and before displaying so packing postponed to just before displaying.
        Overrides:
        setVisible in class java.awt.Dialog
        Parameters:
        visible - if true made visible else hidden

      • whichAreShowPointDisplays

        public java.util.Hashtable<ShowPointDisplay,ShowPointImage> whichAreShowPointDisplays(java.awt.Component[] components,
                                                                                      java.util.Hashtable<ShowPointDisplay,ShowPointImage> list)
        Creates vector of components or subcomponents that are also current show point displays.
        Parameters:
        components - array of components to search for show point displays in
        list - vector to add found show point displays to. If null a new vector will be created if any displays are found
        Returns:
        the input list or a new Vector with found displays added to it or null if no input list was null and no displays were found.
